forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 65, with temperatures falling to around 62 in the afternoon. West wind 18 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind 14 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco this afternoon, a soft warmth half-heartedly lingers as the sun shines above, promising a high near 65 degrees that teeters dangerously upon a cooling descent. The westward breeze dances with vigor, whispering through the streets at 18 to 22 mph, causing the trees to sway and the distant sounds of the city to come alive. Yet, as twilight approaches, clouds will gather, cloaking the city in a gentle embrace with a low settling around 54 degrees. The winds will remain brisk, a comforting reminder of the coastal air that has a way of invigorating the soul.

While the day displays an admirable clarity, hints of the marine layer linger, mostly hanging closer to the horizon where the golden hues of the bridge blur into soft grays. A suggestion of fog may weave through the alcoves, ready to drape over familiar sights, creating that quintessential San Francisco mystique. Such conditions call for light layers—perhaps a long-sleeved shirt with a lightweight jacket for the shift from day to evening, welcoming the nippy winds while enjoying the city's vibrant energy. As for activities, a leisurely stroll through Golden Gate Park or a visit to a local café, savoring the warm embrace of a drink, offers a perfect blend of warmth and charm on this sunlit yet brisk day.
